item.title: Fair warnings
item.description: “[M]any of the truths we cling to depend greatly on our own point of view.” – Obi-Wan Kenobi, “Star Wars Episode VI: Return of the Jedi” (1983) Occasionally, I’m asked I’m a particular Lance Leonard. I’ll admit to being a Lance Leonard, but perhaps not the Lance Leonard you’re looking for. (“Haven’t you heard? I come in six-packs.”) For example, I am *not*: A conservative politician from New Jersey. (You’ve likely reversed the names, not to mention the, well, never mind.

item.title: Privacy policy
item.description: “Now that I do know it, I shall do my best to forget it.” – Sherlock Holmes, “A Study in Scarlet”, by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle (1887) I don’t track you or how you use the site. I don’t record any personally identifying information (PII). No cookies are saved to your device, so there’s nothing to opt in to…or out of. At some point, I may add analytics to help understand how people use the site in general.

item.title: The site name
item.description: A paradox? A paradox, A most ingenious paradox! We’ve quips and quibbles heard in flocks! But none to beat this paradox! – Ruth & Frederic, “The Pirates of Penzance”, Act II (Scene 19), by W.S. Gilbert & Arthur Sullivan, 1879 The site’s name is based, in part, on lyrics from The Pirates of Penzance. (It’s also a subtle nod to one of my earliest doc roles and, yes, there’s a small story or few.
